page.title: 09Ecology, Gt.Asby
page.content: Ecology The area is a mix of moorland and valley, but the wildlife tends to reflect the uplands, with typical curlew, buzzard,lapwing,owl and crow family populations. Foxes and stoats are the main land predators of the large rabbit population. Hares are frequent on ungrazed pastures in winter, retiring to the uplands for Summer. Little pollution means healthy streams supporting a wide variety of life, including trout and breeding kingfishers. Much of the area overlies limestone, and where the soil is particularly thin or absent a typical northern Karst vegetation has developed. The predominant tree is the ash and sycamore on lower ground, with the rowan on higher ground.
